sources.data_found: Duke Compute Cluster (DCC) Overview: States the cluster consists of 'over 1200 nodes' and includes 'over 200 GPU nodes'.
Research Computing Resources: Mentions 'The cluster has... 15,000+ CPU cores and 500+ GPUs'.

student_data.notes: Undergraduate count calculated from Duke Registrar 'Majors by School' data. In Spring 2024, CS was the top major. Specific Spring 2024 declared major count was not explicitly itemized in the public HTML summary, so estimate is derived from the 'Degrees Conferred' report (346 CS Bachelor's degrees in 2023) × 4 years = 1,384 estimated majors. PhD count (139) is exact from Duke Graduate School 'Statistics' page for Fall 2023. Master's count estimated: CS MS program typically graduates ~100-125/year (based on historicals in IPEDS), implies ~250 enrolled (2-year program). [WARNING: Original source was inaccessible, using fallback.]

other_high_vram_gpus.notes: Mentioned in OIT hardware documentation for scavenger/lab partitions.

gpu_resources.notes:
Duke Research Computing operates on a 'Condo' model (researchers buy nodes) + 'Common' infrastructure. Official site (rc.duke.edu) states '500+ GPUs' across '200+ GPU nodes'. Exact inventory is not live-published, so counts are allocated based on the 500 total figure and the hardware types listed in the User Guide (A100, V100, P100, A6000). 

Calculations/Allocations:
1) A100s: Assuming ~40% of fleet are modern tier (A100s). Split 80GB/40GB based on OIT KB listing both. 200 total A100s estimated.
2) V100s: Assuming ~28% of fleet (legacy standard). 140 total estimated.
3) P100s: Assuming ~12% of fleet (older legacy). 60 total estimated.
4) A6000/RTX: Assuming ~20% of fleet (workstation/scavenger class). 100 total estimated.

Total = 500 GPUs. H100s not yet explicitly confirmed in public fleet stats as of May 2025, though likely present in private lab purchases.

compute_credits.description: Duke uses a 'Fair Share' scheduling policy for the Common partition rather than a direct currency/credit system for general usage. Condo owners get priority on their own hardware.

analysis_notes: Duke's decentralized 'Condo' model makes exact counts variable as researchers add nodes monthly. The '500+ GPUs' figure is the official anchor point from RC documentation. Student counts are derived from Registrar degree conferral data due to lack of a single 'Current Enrollment by Major' live dashboard.
